acidity.notes: Darker, more tart berry. A red punch/cherry flavor comes to mind. Almost too much fruitiness this time, especially as it cools.

sweetness.notes: The fruitiness is better balanced in this cup.

body.notes: Substantial, but lets the tasting notes pop out.

finish.notes: Much better. Mouth is not feeling dry, I'm not getting the strong alkaline taste, and I don't feel the urge to wash out the taste with water.

flavor: The tasting notes are back! It's like the coffee went back to being '3D'. Still loads of body, but now I get the cherry zing. The characteristic herb or grass note is back as well â€” it's what reminds me this is a Papua New Guinea roast, and also the one 'off' taste I don't personally care for.
observations: Did not clean sides of filter this time. Kept 45 second bloom and generous swirls/taps/the whole shebang. Drained a little slower than 'normal' but was steady throughout. No stalling.
actionItem: Back off the 24 just to see whether that improves the overall flavor-to-body ratio balance.
